name: Todotxt.net
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: An implementation of todo.txt for Windows using the .NET framework
body:
todotxt.net is an minimalist, keyboard-driven Windows GUI for your [todo.txt](http://todotxt.com) file. > …spend less time managing your tasks and more time working on them - [lifehacker](http://lifehacker.com/5809990/todotxtnet-manages-your-plain-text-to+do-lists-on-windows) The UI is purposefully minimalist and can be completely controlled from via keyboard shortcuts. Most actions can be initiated with a single key, for example ‘n’ to start creating a new task, ‘u’ to update the selected task, or ‘x’ to mark a task as completed. It is fully compliant with Gina’s [format spec](https://github.com/ginatrapani/todo.txt-touch/wiki/Todo.txt-File-Format), which means you can safely edit the file using the Android app or Linux/Mac todo.sh. If you’re interested in trying it out, you can download the installer. If you’re feeling generous and have found the app useful, please feel free to make a donation.

### Download You can download the MSI installer from the [github download page](http://github.com/benrhughes/todotxt.net/downloads). When a new version is released, a notification will appear in the app's menu. ### Contributors - @benrhughes - @mytholus - @steppsr - @ejsmile - @clifb - @arkolbus - @ChrisWay - @Piscean - @robjefferies
